frame.name: Military_operation
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Military</fen> of a <fen>Possessor</fen> (either a nation, institution, or private individual) conducts large-scale activities in a <fen>Area</fen> to accomplish military or combined military/non-military goals.
<ex>These groups are known to have carried out attacks on <fex name="Military">international coalition forces</fex> <t>operating</t> <fex name="Area">in Afghanistan</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="opp">Anti-piracy</fex> <t>operations</t> will continue while new strategies are developed.</ex>
This frame construes the operation asymmetrically: the <fen>Military</fen> acts with respect to military and political entities in the target <fen>Area</fen>. Compare this to (usually, but not always, lower-level and violent) military actions that can be understood symmetrically (<m>war</m>, <m>battle</m>, <m>encounter</m>, <m>engagement</m>, etc).</def-root>

FE.name: Force
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Force</fen> carries out the operation. Depending on the size of the operation, this may be as few as one individual or as large as the armed forces of a nation.
<ex><fex name="mil">He</fex> died while <m>carrying out</m> counter-IED <t>operations</t>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="mil">US forces</fex> currently <t>operating</t> in Iraq are due to be recalled within the next several months.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Possessor</fen> controls the army and ultimately directs its goals and methods.</def-root>

FE.name: Area
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Area</fen> in which the <fen>Military</fen> is conducting operations.</def-root>

FE.name: Opponent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The nation, group, or situation which the operation opposes.
<ex><t>Operations</t> <fex name="opp">against Afghanistan</fex> continue to be carried out.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the operations are carried out.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time over which the operation is carried out.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>A description of the operation or participants that are not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Military</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The means by which the <fen>Military</fen> carries out its operation.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> of the operation, e.g., military, intelligence.
<ex>NATO forces are <m>conducting</m> <fex name="dom">military</fex> <t>operations</t> in highly volatile regions.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> of the operation.
<ex>He was captured in a covert <fex name="goa">arrest</fex> <t>operation</t> carried out by an elite group of highly-trained Marines.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location of the operation.
<ex>This sort of <t>operation</t> should only be <m>conducted</m> <fex name="pla">in open areas</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: operation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a set of military actions carried out with a certain goal or goals.

lexUnit.name: operate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be militarily active or perform military actions.
